“Ingrid Leviathan.”


“Ah the youngest of the Leviathan. I remember her. She was still a kid during the Great War. Very different from that snorty elder sister of hers. Leviathan used to tell me about her sometimes when we drank together. How is she nowadays?”


“She passed away while I was in a comatose state.” She replied in a sombre tone.


“Ah….I see. Was it during the….”


“Ingrid Leviathan didn’t participate in the Civil War.” Zekram interrupted. “In fact, she was against it and left the underworld and was not heard about….till now. Who is your father, child?” Zekram asked, far more kindly this time.


“I….my Father was a human.”


“....I see. Do you know how your mother passed away?” He asked and she shook her head.


“I had fallen into the Sleeping Sickness and was sent outside for treatment. When I awakened, I was informed that she had passed away.”


“You woke up from the Sleeping Sickness?” He asked, stunned.


“She awakened her Sacred Gear and it jolted her awake.” Sirzechs interrupted and explained.


“Sacred Gear….half human. I see. So what do you intend to do now?”


“I….I just want to work for….” She took a look at me and then steeled herself. “I just wish to work for my King and help him achieve his dreams.”


“I see. Then I wish you best of luck. Having the bloodlines of the Satans is indeed a thing to celebrate.” He nodded.


I couldn’t resist slightly raising my eyebrow, especially because I didn’t sense any lie from him.


The man saw this and let out a sigh. “Just what kind of boogeyman do you all think I am? I have no problem with these things. If anything I welcome such additions as it helps restore the previous strength of the Underworld. I have nothing against it as long as it doesn’t become a danger to the Underworld. Having a Satan’s bloodline back with us is a blessing. Even if the kids almost never inherit the Traits of the Satans themselves, just the insane amounts of Demonic Power they possess could grant us another peak Ultimate Class Devil or with some luck even a Satan Class with proper training.”


“Wait, what do you mean by they don’t inherit their Clan Traits?” Serafall asked and even I was a bit confused.


“Satan Bloodlines are different from ours, probably due to being demons originally and not created by Lilith and Lucifer. All of them have several times more Demonic Power compared to even other Pillar Clans which put them in a class above any common devil.”


“There are several other traits to nuances to their bloodlines too like all Leviathan Clan members being born as girls and all Asmodeus being boys.” Runeas added.


I wanted to reject her theory as the actual Leviathan, the father of Satan Leviathan was actually a guy but then I stopped myself. There could have been changes in the time she was hiding in the pits. Probably something changed in her bloodline after she became a devil which was carried forward.


Zekram continued. “It is however their Clan Traits which are almost never passed down to their children. The ‘Demonic Brilliance of Evil Light’ of Lucifer, ‘King of Flies’ of the Beelzebub, ‘Starsent Moment’ of the Asmodeus and finally the ‘Sea Serpent of the End’ of the Leviathan. These were powers beyond any Clan Traits of the Pillar Clans bar perhaps my own and….” he threw a look at me. “The Life Magic of the Zagan.”


This got raised eyebrows from both the Satans present.


“It was for this reason I was given the title of the Great King of the Underworld and Zagan was considered for the second Great King.” He dropped a bomb.


“Say what….” I blurted before I understood what was going on. 


“Yeah that actually happened.” Runeas added. “It was actually proposed by Lilith probably because Zagan was her favourite. They were both users of Life Magic after all. Too bad Beelzebub was a prick about the whole thing because Zagan could create hundreds of types of organisms compared to his own bees. Talk about petty. Even Leviathan thought he was being a whiny bastard, told me and Lilith herself when we were drinking. Mom almost never joined our drinking sessions but she was absolutely pissed that day and had drunk Leviathan out of her entire bar.  That day….I learned that the first lady of the Devil race could swear bad enough to make angels bleed in the ears.”


“Zagan himself was actually happy that he wasn’t dragged into even more work and could spend more time in his lab. Seriously….sigh. I never understood that guy’s mind.” Zekram added as he picked up his glass of wine and took a sip. “Oh, this is indeed fine.”


All of us were listening to stories no one had any idea about.


“Coming back to the topic, those clan traits were almost never inherited by their children. Even Rizevim, despite his insane power didn’t inherit his father’s power so he created a magic of his own, his so-called Sacred Gear Canceller.”


“Really?! I thought that was a power unique to him?” Sirzechs said, surprised.


“Nope. Now you see why these traits are so rare.”


“But….Ingvild did inherit her grandmother’s trait.” Serafall interrupted, making both of the older devils turn towards her, surprised. “And not only that, she is already a Satan Class Devil in terms of Demonic Power even when she was asleep for the last one hundred years. She’s a genius, isn’t she?”


“That’s….indeed very rare.” Runeas nodded.


The girl was apparently too embarrassed by all the attention on her so she looked at her feet.


“All the better for the Underworld.” Zekram spoke. “But let’s come to the main topic for today.” He looked at me.


Let’s see what he wanted to say.


- Armin -


“What do you recommend, Armin?” His mother asked as she looked around the place for what to buy.


Matty had offered him and his family his permission to directly get anything they wanted from his farm without any of this card business and he too preferred it that way but today was different.


Today they were here to promote his products in front of the whole underworld so he brought his mother, Lisbell and Lilitifa to buy things.


Even Euclid had followed them with his own family while his brother and Satan Beelzebub were answering questions about the safety tests done with the products to any who had doubts.


They were currently on the fourth floor with D Ranked products.


He personally needed C Ranked products but he could directly order it from the farm. Despite Matty’s offer, he didn’t want his friend to be at a loss.


These products were mostly for Lisbell and Lilitifa.


“I would recommend the fruits. Blue Hawaiiokan, Mirror Lychee and Saphialmond would be a good choice.” He showed them the items and they placed orders.


“Oh my, these things look like pure Sapphires. How pretty. Can we really eat these?” His mother asked, looking at the Saphialmonds.


Several people were watching them to see what they did so he picked up one of the almonds and took a bite in front of the whole crowd.


“Yes, obviously. These ones are my favourites. Actually I think you should get the Perfect Beauty Cattle meat and Smooth Skin Bean Sprouts. These two things are extremely good for the skin and body and will be out soon once people find out about it.” He advised while making sure his voice was heard by others around him.


“Is that true, Euclid?” The man’s wife asked him on hearing his explanation.


“Well yes. We did confirm it.”


And apparently that was all that was needed.


A crowd of ladies rushed towards the counters, leaving the men behind.


“I will never understand this. Can’t they use Demonic Power to retain their youth?” He asked Euclid.


The man just gave him a smile and patted his shoulder. “You have a lot to learn, Armin. A lot to learn.”


….that explained nothing.


He walked around to the other floors to check if there were any troubles and was approached by several reporters.


Today however, he didn’t run away and faced them head on.


“Heir Glasya-Labolas, how do you feel about these products?”


“You have been a friend of Lord Buné Zagan for a long time. What can you tell us about him?”


“Do you think his claims are true?”


“Can his products really do what he says?”


“When will we see you in another Rating Game?”


“There are rumours that you have been undergoing some kind of secret training from Lord Asmodeus in this time that you were away. Is it true?”


Say what?


“Kyaa~ Armin, marry me.”


….


And then there were such people.


He let out an internal sigh as he got ready to answer their questions.


Matty better appreciate this.


“No. I haven’t been getting any special training from Lord Asmodeus. I just have been spending more time gathering a good enough peerage and training them. I can’t win all the Rating Games alone, can I?” He answered.


“Yes. Mathias and I have been good friends for a long time. He is one of the most dedicated and talented people I have had the fortune of meeting and knowing.”


“Also yes, Mathias’ products are indeed just as he claims. I….personally have tried them and can attest to their effectiveness.” He accepted.


And with it the press grew even louder.


“Are you saying that the secret behind your strength are the Special Zagan Food Items?” Several of them asked.


“My growth in power in these last few years is almost inseparable from these products. But I want to remind everyone again that these products only give the best results when the people push their body to their limits. Please always remember it. While they do provide an increase in even natural growth, it would be nothing compared to truly pushing yourself and training hard.”


With his admission, the crowd went wild and the sales increased almost instantly.


He just hoped things went on smoothly for the rest of the day too.

title: Story 2: Chapter 13: Reactions and Politics
content:
Story 2: The Farmer


Disclaimer: I own nothing.


Chapter 13: Reactions and Politics


____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


- Mathias -


I walked out of the Interview Room and met Rias, Latia and Armin who were waiting for me there.


“So? How did I do?” I asked them.


“It was good. At least with the reveal of your special products, people inside the council will think twice before being too hard on you in fear of pushing you away. It should reduce your load a bit.”


“Ughh… I still have that, don’t I? Maybe I should have let Riser punch me a bit and then pretend to be injured and not attend the council gathering.” I moaned.


“He would have broken his hand.” Armin rolled his eyes.


“Don’t worry. Father and the other people of the alliance will all support you. You just need to make your presence and leave. After that, there is no need to attend all the meetings. Only appearing once every year will be necessary. By then we can easily consolidate our position.” Rias said.


I looked at her surprised. She knew politics?


The girl blushed and explained. “I have been taking classes from Mother on politics to help the Buné and Zagan Houses in the future.”


A smile appeared on my face and I hugged her lightly. “Thank you.”


“You don’t need to thank me. It’s going to be my family too.” 


“Alright, I will handle the gathering.”


It was just a gathering of old coots. How bad could it be?


___________________________________x__________________________________


Kill me.


This is annoying as fuck.


“Bored already?” Zeoticus asked me.


“More than you can think. How can people babble so much about stupid inconsequential things for hours straight with such confidence and pride? This was supposed to be a general meeting to discuss the events of this year and the effect it would have on the Devil Race, right?”


“That’s what it is supposed to be?”


“Then how did this change into a discussion about the next Annual Pillar Gathering and even if it did, then why is it taking this much time? Just recommend a few people and make a committee and throw the responsibility for organisation on them and concentrate on the more important topics. I don’t believe that a New Year party is the most important topic of discussion in the whole Underworld.”


“Hahahaha this is the way things work here. As long as something doesn’t endanger the Underworld, people here rarely concentrate on serious topics. There is more than one reason for it.” Euclid explained.


He was also the Head of the Lucifuge House, one of the only three houses among the Extra Demons to have joined the Current Government along with Mephistopheles and the Mamon House. This allowed him the privilege to attend and even vote in the council meetings. Apart from the House Heads, the Ultimate Class Devils were also given a vote each when passing laws.


It was one of the reasons why the Rating Games and the Top Ten Players were so important. It was because all of them were Ultimate Class. This was also a reason why it wasn’t so easy to become an Ultimate Class just by having Ultimate Class Strength.


“What reasons?”


“Devils are a long lived race. Especially the older devils who are thousands of years old. Their way of perceiving time is different from the young ones.”


I looked at him incredulously.


“Things change when you live that long.” He shrugged.


“Sometimes I wonder if these people stopped boasting so much and put this time into actually discussing how to do good for the underworld… the devil race would have been far better by now. I mean it’s not that much time either. Just a few hours.”


“Oh just you wait till it’s time to discuss business. These same people will become hell hounds fighting for a piece of meat.” Zeoticus whispered while still smiling towards the crowd. “In fact, you will get to experience it today as well.”


I sighed.


So troublesome.


The moment came surely enough.


I heard my name being called out and looked forward.


A guy, Victus Uvall, a member of the Great King faction and one of the lackeys of Lord Bael who had come with him back then to invite me to their faction.


“My congratulations on ascending to your position as the Lord of Zagan and Buné houses. We are all excited to have two reputable names with us once more.”


….


I didn’t need my rank of Senjutsu to know that he felt nothing of what he was saying.


“Thank you. I look forward to working towards the betterment of the Devil Race with everyone.” I smiled my best fake smile.


Seriously, I should have gained a skill for fake smiling with the amount of times I had practised this.


“Indeed. This is a very joyful occasion for our race and I am sure that we would be seeing a very rapid growth in the Devil race soon but….your news of ascension or even the existence of a Zagan descendant came as a surprise. I have heard that the Satans had chosen to keep your existence a secret to protect you from people who would target you for your Zagan heritage. But… was this really necessary? The Devil Race is far stronger than the Fallen Angels and the Angels right now. Don’t you think that the Satans had overreacted a little?”


….


I looked at Euclid beside me and gave him a look as if asking if this guy was an idiot?


Is this the kind of stupidity I have to deal with all day?


Since they were being this dumb, I decided to treat them the same way.


“No.”


….


They waited for me to continue but I didn’t.


After a few more moments of silence, the guy looked at me awkwardly. “Excuse me?”


“You asked me a question and I gave you the answer.” I shrugged.


….


I could feel him trying to control his lips from twitching.


“Is that all? Do you have nothing more to add?” He asked.


I stared back at the guy and seeing that he didn’t give up, I decided to be a bit more straightforward. I picked up a glass and showed it to him.


“What is this Lord Uvall?”


The guy stared at me, confused so I showed him the glass again.


“A glass full of water.”


“Is that all? Nothing more to add?”


The guy’s face flushed.


“When the answer to someone’s question is obvious, even a single word can suffice as an answer. The Zagan House was specifically hunted by the other two factions even after the Great War had ended till there were almost no members left alive… publicly at least. The Satans had considered this offered me a choice and I chose to keep my identity hidden. Why is that so hard to believe? Or are you saying that I should have bet the continued existence of my houses on an ‘if’?”


A hint of rage appeared on his face at my answer but he quickly hid it away.


“I apologise for being insensitive, Lord Zagan. What I was saying was that we all, the entire Devil race would have lent a hand to protect such an important member of our race if only we knew. You could have also gained access to more people than you did. Was it really worth it, being confined all this time in a small place?”


“Yes.”


….


Don’t give them any chance to pressure me. If they gain a footing then they will drag the talks too much.


Looking at the annoyed face of the man before me I let out an internal smirk.


“You seem to have some more questions, Lord Uvall.” I asked this time, taking the initiative.


“I don’t know what kind of life you have experienced but it is kinda sad to see that you don’t trust the abilities of our race to protect you and your house. I wonder what happened to you to have so low trust in the Underworld.” He shrugged disappointedly.


I narrowed my eyes.


Trying to turn the public against me.


“Stop twisting the meaning of his words, Lord Uvall.” Zeoticus started to speak but I shook my head towards him, making him stop.


Since they are trying to pick a fight against me, it wouldn’t be good to hide behind my allies.


Leila had warned me of their tactics.


A few of them will apply pressure on me while their leaders will pretend to offer a hand. If I accept them, they can set the rules of the alliance since I would be on the backfoot.


This is exactly why I hated politics.


But… it didn’t mean I would let anyone bully me.


“You are correct Lord Uvall. I have very low trust in the capabilities of the one you mentioned to protect me.”


….


That gained the attention of everyone in the place.


“Matty…” Euclid tried to speak but I raised a hand and stopped him.


“I see that you still don’t understand  the situation. Seriously, you should go and read on the topic a bit before you speak and waste the time of the entire council. But since things have come to this point, let me clearly enlighten you, not with some baseless words but rather concrete facts.”


The man who certainly wasn’t expecting this kind of reply and was taken aback for a while.


“Eighty five members of the Zagan House have been assassinated inside the Underworld, in the so-called protection that you are flaunting about.”


“But that was during the Great War. Times are different now. Surely…”


“Again, I really wish you would do some research on something before wasting my time. Only thirty eight members among those had been killed during the Great War. A fun fact was that most of them were due to misinformation. And before you say anything, I have the records of each and every killing in detail. In fact, these records are even present in the Lucifer Archives at New Lilith in case anyone wants to read them. You should probably go there and read them and then try to question me about this stupid topic.”


He opened his mouth but before he could say anything, I continued, not giving him a chance to speak.


“You say that the entire Underworld would have protected me and my house, correct?” I asked.


He nodded. “I am sure….”


“Then where were they when over forty of my family members were killed? I am sure that after some time everyone would have realised that the other factions were targeting my house, so why didn’t anyone try to protect them?”


“Those were tough times. Everyone was recuperating after the war and there was also rising tensions due to the descendants of the previous Satans wanting to restart the Great War.”


“And that’s the first reason. If a situation arises where they had to choose, they would choose their own protection over mine. It’s a fact that my mother survived for so long by keeping her identity a secret. I decided to do the same for my own protection. The only reason she was even killed was due to a coincidence….by one of the people you say would protect me. I don’t see why people are making so much noise regarding this simple fact.”


“Not everyone is like that.”


“True, but… I couldn’t risk even one more person being like that. You keep on forgetting that this was the last chance for my house.”


That made them quiet.


“Alright, it seems that you are starting to understand things now. In that case let me ask you a question in return since you are so concerned about my mental and social well being.”


“Yes?”


“When my parents were killed, I sent an invitation to all of the Pillars. Some responded personally, while some sent servants. As far as I recall, your house didn’t even respond to the invitation. Why is that so?”


The man’s face flushed. “I’m sorry for not being able to offer my condolences but I was…”


“At New Lilith organising an Art Exhibition.” I interrupted, making him clamp his mouth shut.


“Matty…” Euclid tried to stop me.


“Just a moment, Euclid. If I don’t stop this nons… I mean if I don’t clear Lord Uvall’s doubts then everyone will think I am easy to bull… I mean will have doubts. It’s better to take care of things once and for all. I don’t mind questions as long as the other side has done sincere investigations and has actual doubts but I have zero tolerance for people who waste my time with such useless questions.” I turned back to the guy who was completely quiet now.


“My apologies for the interruptions. So, I see that organising an Art exhibition was more important for you than attending the funeral of one of the Pillar Heads. With examples like this… how do you expect me to trust the people with these kinds of priorities to protect me during times of danger? I am sure you understand how assassinations are done? The assassins don’t announce that they are going to attack someone in advance.”


Seeing no reply, I continued. “I am very grateful to the current Satans for giving me the necessary protection and agreeing to my request to keep my status a secret until the time that I felt I was ready to rise up to my responsibilities. As for the ones I came into contact with, it was done by me of my own violation. In fact, as stated in the interview, I revealed my identity to anyone who talked civilly with me for a month. How do you expect me to trust people who didn’t even talk to the heir of an endangered house like the Buné, to protect me in times of danger?” I looked around and there were many types of reactions.


Some people avoided my eyes while some other people glared at me for pointing this out and more or less slapping them right in the face.


“Does anyone have any questions?”


No questions came.


- Euclid -


Damn… this was what he was worrying about.


They pushed Matty and he snapped back at them.


None of them would have expected to encounter such a person.


As expected none of them questioned him next and turned their attention towards Sirzechs next.


He quickly used a small barrier to isolate them from others.


“Was it really alright to do that Matty?”


“It was. I know what they were doing, however I don't care. The thing I wanted is done already. Now, even if those idiots invited me, I can just pretend to be irritated by Uvall and deny. After all, I am just a hot blooded eighteen year old with more power than they think I’m worthy of. This kind of behaviour was to be expected.”


….


“You were hoping for this?” Euclid looked at me incredulously.


“Yup.”


“For the next few years, I will have no time to worry about them. As long as I get this time, I will be able to stabilise my territories and then get back to this.”


“But won’t they create more trouble for you?” He asked. “It will take out more time from your already busy schedule.”


“That might not necessarily be the case.” Lord Gremory sitting beside him spoke.


He looked at the man for explanation and he explained. “Mathias has something which their previous targets didn’t have.”


“What thing?”


“Monopoly. Mathias has a complete monopoly on products which is going to become nigh compulsory for the development of any house in a few years time. They could hate him all they want but they will have to trade with him on his own terms once his business is established.”


He looked at the boy who was looking forward with a stoic look on his face. “Is that what you were counting on, Matty?”


“Among other things,” he answered.


“Oh! What other things are you targeting?” Lord Gremory asked curiously.


He looked towards them. “What is the best they can do to hinder my business?” he asked.


“Hmm, they might stop the sales of the products in their territories, cutting into your profits. They might spread false rumours to reduce the credibility of your products.”


“Spreading false rumours will not work in the long term as long as the ones in the territories of my allies are not affected. Moreover, I have the certifications of the Research and Development Department. It will be very hard to directly say that my products are faulty. As for cutting the sales in their territories. That’s exactly what I want.”


Lord Gremory raised an eyebrow.


“Tell me Lord Gremo…”


“Call me Father.” the guy interrupted and Euclid rolled his eyes.


“... father, tell me, if you were a Low or Middle Class Devil living in their territory and you saw that the Devils of the same class in other territories were getting stronger after eating my food while you were not even getting access to it or if you could then at an extremely inflated price through some underground channels, then what would you do?”


“...I…” The man was about to speak but paused and looked at him in stunned silence. Euclid did the same too.


“You were targeting their people from the very start. You want them to cut off the sales so that the people in their territories migrate to yours.” Euclid asked, stunned.


He shrugged. “I need people to come to my territory and these people will have to come from somewhere.”


“That’s… very cunning of you Matty.” He looked at the usually straightforward guy as if seeing him for the first time. That was ruthless.


“It wasn’t my original plan. This plan was actually made due to an idea from Rias. She wanted to think of a way we could rob the people from the territories of the people who had commented badly about my Rating Game and it struck a chord with us. Later on, all three of us, Rias, Latia and I planned this. Things will obviously not be so easy but there will certainly be some effects. And that will not be the end either.”


“Obviously. To stop the outflow of population, they will have to agree to your terms of trade no matter how ridiculous. That’s indeed ruthless. Just what is Venelana teaching the girl?” Lord Gremory shook his head but it was easy to notice the smile on his face.


Seriously?


As if that blackhearted businesswoman wasn’t enough. Now even the other finance was becoming a blackhearted politician.


Did Mathias have an affinity for these types?


Sirzechs and Serafall managed to keep them in control.


Finally the main topic came.


“I would like to ask Lord Buné Zagan a question.” Lord Amy stood up and asked.


Mathias looked at him and nodded.


“I have heard about what you said about your farm products and their effects. I would like to confirm if they are true once more.” he asked.


And sure enough the attention of the entire council turned towards Mathias.


“Yes. Every word I said is true. The products were tested and their results were verified by the Devil Research and Development Department and they have been certified as well.” He answered.


Euclid took this chance to stand up and verify the statement.


“Over the last three years, both Satan Beelzebub and myself have worked on all these products and verified their effects.”


Falbium also took this chance to throw in his own words. “It’s true. I tested the effect of those things on a squad of my soldiers as well. They are completely safe and have the stated effects. The Defense Department is currently discussing a deal for a stable supply of these grains for our Military as well.”


He saw the expressions of the people change all over the hall.


The Amy Devil also had various emotions circle his face before controlling them quickly. “That is indeed great news for the Devil Race. I would like to thank Lord Buné Zagan for such a gift. May I ask how these grains will be distributed? I must admit that I am quite excited about tasting them for myself.”


“They will be sold from tomorrow at selected outlets. I will slowly expand the business at my own pace.” Mathias replied.


“Yes. Your speech about eradicating hunger from the Underworld and it was inspiring. If possible, we would like to lend a hand towards such a noble goal as well.”


Mathias nodded and Euclid internally rolled his eyes.


Just a few days ago, they were more or less threatening Mathias to join under them and now their tones change completely.


“It just so happens that the Amy House and the Shax Houses have the best distribution chain in the Underworld and we would like to assist in the sales and proper distribution of your products through the underworld.” Lord Amy said, acting like a benevolent guy.


Obviously his act fooled no one, even less someone like Mathias.


That high ranked Senjutsu skill was hard to deceive.


“I appreciate your thoughts Lord Amy but as it happens, I already have distributors for my current supply. As I have already stated, my products increase the growth rates of people, it is an extremely valuable resource. I wish to control its distribution quite closely. Thus, I wish to start small and then slowly expand. For this, I have already made contracts with around a dozen houses and will expand to their territories after the capital Satan Cities. My own stores will be opened in collaboration with the owners of the territories. In the future, when I expand to other territories, I wish to follow the same method and as such I am in no immediate need of a distribution channel.”


Smart.


This would make the Lords of the Houses side with him and not have a middleman like the Amy and Shax Houses to come in between.


Now even if these two wish to pressure Mathias, they will be stopped by other houses who will try to get a share of the pie.


A stick with the firm and blatant answer to Lord Uvall and then a carrot for the other houses to bite.


Well played.


As expected, those two knew this as well and didn’t push much for now.


Another person got up this time.


Cain Marbas.


“I have another question. This time for Lord Lucifer.”


Sirzechs nodded.


“This has been the first time that someone has become the Lord of two houses. And while I am delighted to have two houses recover from the verge of extinction, it still causes a distortion in the balance of power. I wonder what your thoughts are about this?”


“There are no current or past laws stating that one person cannot be the Head of two houses at the same time. The Underworld has lost more than half the Pillar Houses in the Great War and the Civil War and a few more have lost their status after that. It has caused the power to get concentrated in the hands of fewer people. Such a thing is also bad for a healthy government as well as the future of the Underworld and as such our priority should be to stop the number of Pillar Houses from decreasing first. As for the matter of the power of two houses being in the hands of one person, it’s only for one generation. Mathias is engaged to two different people and the Lordships will separate into different hands in the future and solve this automatically.”


There were some more questions but people more or less avoided directly targeting Mathias for now.


The rest of the meeting went quite smoothly.


- Lord Phenex -


He looked at his youngest son sulking, still refusing to accept his defeat.


“He was just lucky that I didn’t know about his Clan Trait. If we fought again, I can…”


Finally tired of it, he decided to stop the matters himself.


“You would be able to do nothing.” he stated, making him turn towards him surprised.


“Father?”

Zekram had a strange look on his face. “Yes. Zagans were always weird. Strange but talented nonetheless. After all, there was a reason Lord Lucifer wanted to name him as the second Great King of the Underworld. The Great King of Creation, mirroring my own self.”


What!

“Yeah. If only Beelzebub hadn’t been a prick back then. I mean what reason was there for him to be jealous of Zagan because he could make more kinds of flies than him? Even little kids aren’t that petty.”


….


“Only they knew what went on in their heads. From your words it seems that you like him.”


“Hmm.”


“I guess I will have to invite him over for tea sometime. I would have already if I had been informed earlier.” He looked at them and then back towards his wine.


“It was for the safety of Mathias. Even we were not told anything about him.” Her mother-in-law defended.


“Oh drop it. You know those fools on the council would have chewed the boy out before he could even grow. Not to mention that mess with Naberius. Seriously, what’s wrong with these fools? If you are experimenting on people, do it to other races. There are still angels and fallen angels alive in this world. Why go after our own?” Runeas complained.


“Just because they call themselves the Great King faction doesn’t mean they are all controlled by me. Most of the time, I don’t even know what they do. And I don’t interfere as long as they don’t go too far. That’s how children grow after all. What Naberius did had crossed the line and thus the entire house is currently suffering. I didn’t defend him.” Zekram shrugged, pouring himself another cup.


“Hmm. Isn’t that because you are lazy?” Runeas joked.


“Says the one who sleeps for thousands of years.”


“Touché.” She smiled.

She nodded. “They get along very well.”

I would not let someone even more talented than him turn against the underworld.”

“Is this really necessary?” I asked Rias for the umpteenth time.

I mean I could totally use some of the other clothes I have but what’s the use of destroying clothes worth millions of Lilium just to show off.


At least that’s my way of thinking… which is apparently wrong.




“Good. Although I doubt that level of Dragon Flame would even singe your hair. Next time maybe, you can get clothes of a better design instead of these. What’s next? Are you going to carry a shovel to the fight?”

….


It did bring a light smile to their faces and cooled the atmosphere a little bit.

Although, they do have a good taste in clothes.


One of the Gremory’s primary businesses is clothing and Latia has been a little princess from the very start so both of them have a very high standard for clothing.


They don’t mind wearing farm clothes while training but they wouldn’t go out in one of them… ever.


“There, all done.” Rias said, after stepping back and taking a final look at me.


I looked at myself in the mirror and I did look good.


The crests of both my houses were on my chest. Finally, there was no need to hide things. It’s been so long that I feel a bit strange wearing this outside.

The little guy had gotten better but he was still only twelve years old and having a bit of stage fear was quite understandable.

Tia will not be fighting for obvious reasons. I didn’t ask Crom to fight either.

If we got along well, I revealed my identity to them. It’s just that simple. So please, think twice before blaming anyone. Secondly, the decision of the engagement was totally my fiances’ and mine. Their families had just supported us as we took our time getting to know each other first before deciding to sign the contract. In fact, I was the one who proposed it. If in doing so I couldn’t meet someone else who might have been more compatible with me, a fact I seriously doubt, then we were just not fated.”


“That’s… will you be taking any other wives or concubines… to revive your houses?”


“I have just entered into an engagement contract with two very beautiful and lovely girls. I would like to take some time to get used to it before I think about more.”


“Oh, you three seem to have a very good relationship. My congratulations.”


“Thank you.”


“Lastly, as the Lord of the Duke Buné and King Zagan Houses, you must understand that you command quite a bit of power, so, what is it that you wish to do going forward?”


“Hmm, right now I have my hands full restoring my territories and the names of Duke Buné and King Zagan. When I am done with it, I will concentrate on my farm to make the Underworld completely independent of any kind of food imports and make it self sustainable. I do not wish for anyone to go hungry in the Underworld… ever.”


“That’s quite a great goal. I sincerely wish you can achieve it to bring about the rise of our race.”


“I hope so too.” Mathias replied as they got up, ending the interview.


She and the rest got up as well.


Mathias had done his turn, now it was their turn to get the business of the House.


- Azazel -


He watched the news broadcast end as the newly ascended, Lord Mathias Buné Zagan completed his interview.


Zagan.


They had really thought that name was extinct.


He still remembered the times of the Great War.


The overall threat assessment of the first Zagan was second only to one other devil… their brother and the creator of the Devil Race, Lucifer himself.


His ability to create hoards of demonic beasts, although mindless, was assessed as the most dangerous ability, so much so that even Father decided to send Saraqael of all his sons to take him down.


And even after the death of the first Zagan, they hadn’t forgotten the fact that he had taken down Saraqael with him as well as the danger such a power could possess if it surfaces again and thus, they had hunted down the Zagan descendants using every possible means necessary, going as far as to team up with Angels and church to do so.


Their efforts had shown results as well when the Zagan name had all but disappeared from the records of the Underworld as a whole… but it seems there were survivors.


Mathias Buné Zagan.


He had ordered the records of his first Rating Game to be brought as soon as he found out about his name and the guy confirmed his fears. He could indeed use Life Magic.


Being drowned by sheer numbers.


Neither Rüdiger Rosenkreutz nor Riser Phenex had truly understood the horrors of Life Magic or he would have started to bombard the area from a distance till he exhausted his Demonic Power and then run for his life rather than stand there and throw dialogues.


Those fools.


And it would seem that this Zagan was far more dangerous in a completely different way if he could make food like that along with the Demonic Beasts.


Too bad, neither the Grigori nor Heaven can afford another Archangel to go after him… not to mention the fact that he was related to those two monsters through their sisters. Even laying a finger on him would most likely start a war.


And even if that were not the case, then the Grigori currently had no free hands to spare after the mess caused by Satanael. If he were to make any moves now, he would earn the ire of the other factions as well.


He didn’t fail to notice that he had the former Suzaku Himejima in his peerage and matched with the fact that his little fiance had Baraqiel’s daughter in her peerage, it would be hurting his brother as well, causing their already sour relationship to break beyond repair.


Really, those four brats had checkmated everyone with this move.

title: Story 2: Chapter 11: The Birthday (Part - 2)

Story 2: Bune Farmer
