“Well then, show me the test for your Buné Trait, you can just show the Dragonification part and we will be done.”


The test was completed without a hitch. The boy could only do a partial Dragonification but even that was self learned. He was a talented child.


“Okay, now let’s go to my room and you can show me the things you want to sell. I would love to see the best tasting veggies in the Underworld.” He teleported everyone back to the office room but not before an instruction towards the head examiner to bring everyone who witnessed the test to a different room and isolate them.


He would need to erase their memories to keep the matters secret.


- Scene Change -


“So, this cutie made all these things?” Serafall asked him, looking at the plates of vegetables placed in front of them.


“Hmm. I had to ask him for these to have them tested before they could be sold.” He took a bite of the salad in front of him and had to agree with the boy’s claims of this being the best vegetables in the Underworld. He would have bought these even without the special attributes of these new vegetables.


“Could the first Zagan or any for that matter make anything like… well, this?” Falbium asked, looking at the seemingly simple plate of salad.


“I don’t know. But if he did, I can see why Heaven would send an Archangel on a suicidal mission to take him down before the Great War. Unfortunately the first Zagan had perished before even our parents were born, actually being the first one to be killed and we don’t have any information about him. The ones who still know about his powers are the old devils and they need to be kept out of this. They would eat a poor child like Mathias.” he replied.


They looked at the final Satan in the room.


“Or it could be a mutation like…” Ajuka left the words unsaid and that only made matters worse.


Another one of their kind.


Super Devil is the last tag he would want on the boy’s head above everything else.


He shook his head and looked at Ajuka, “What did you find out about these? Are they safe? Do they have any side effects?”


Ajuka shook his head, “No. The products were completely safe, including the two rabbits he gave to your sisters. The food products each have different effects. The lettuce enhances the cell activity and increases the growth of physical strength of the body, essentially promoting the physique. The others had slight effects on increasing the elemental affinity of different elements. It was very little but still present nonetheless. My estimates are that if someone eats these for a decade or two, they can be attuned to those elements and have a much easier time with the magic of the element.”


“What about those light and holy element ones?” Falbium asked.


Those two would really cause the Angels and the Fallen to go for another suicide attack on the child. He could understand why he wanted to keep those things secret.


“I would need to test those on criminals but from my estimate, those should increase resistance, although they will not give any devils any affinity with the element if they don’t already have it.” Ajuka replied.


“Did he tell you how many he could prepare in a short period of time?” Falbium asked.


“I forbade him from producing them for the time being. To be honest, the boy wouldn’t have revealed even the elemental ones if I hadn’t used slight hypnotism when I brought him for a physical checkup to see if he had any existing injuries from the poison. He intended to keep them all secret until he was strong enough. It is better if we keep this under wraps for now. The internal devil factions will be enough to deal with. We don’t need to involve other factions in this.” he declared. He could see Falbium’s disappointment and understood it too. He was the one incharge of the armies and such a thing would be a boon for any devil army. But this matter needed to be kept hidden for now.


He did feel guilty getting things out of the boy by using hypnotism but he couldn’t afford not to, given the situation. He even had to erase and modify the memories of his sister while Serafall did it for her own. Any and all members who had witnessed the demonstration had their memories modified by Ajuka and changed so that they only remember the Buné Trait being exhibited. The files were all kept directly under him and couldn’t be accessed by anyone without his direct permission.  As compensation, he assigned the boy double the normal stipend and any books on magic that he wanted through an access to one of his libraries managed by his bishop Mathers.


He let out a sigh. The things he did for this job. He didn’t lie when he said that he didn’t like politics but if he left the current devil society to those old devils, the entire race will face another civil war in less than a decade.


“That was a good decision.” Serafall agreed. “I cannot imagine having to explain it to the other factions if they somehow found out about it. Anyways, did you find out anything about the maid and the clerk? And what about the peerage members of his parents? The whole situation smells fishy to me. Two peerages of veteran hunters couldn’t be wiped out so easily. The cutie had the sign of the Head of the Clans on both his Magic Crests so it meant that both those Heads were dead. The peerage members however remained unaccounted for. These two incidents could be connected.”


“They are still being questioned. The clerk was the husband of the maid. They were stealing the child’s stipend for over a year along with many of the remaining relics of the two Clans and selling them in the black market. The maid was actually afraid when the boy turned twelve and wanted to get his Trait checked. Such a test would have definitely been reported to me because it involved the matters of a Pillar House or even two. She in her panicked state poisoned the boy and tried to make the scene as if a suicide. The child’s Buné Trait helped him survive the attack. Dragons are resistant to most general poisons. She however claims to know nothing about him knowing or even possessing Clan Traits or Magic for that matter. I have sent Mathers and Souji to find and recover those relics and books although it might be nigh impossible with how much time passed. The books or remaining relics might hold some emotional value for the kid and might help get his favour.” He even liquefied the properties of the clerk and maid and moved it to the Buné accounts as well as gave the boy a Phenex Tear as an apology for his staff’s actions. 


The Phenex Tear would probably help save his life if he found himself in such a situation every again.


It would also work as a way of explanation for anyone who found out that a Clan Heir and now the Clan Head was not only robbed but also poisoned and nearly murdered by the someone working in his own office.


A scandal that would be.


“The peerage members?” Falbium asked.


He shook his head, “I have no idea.”


“Hmm, I will send some people to see if they can be found. I would directly declare them rogue but you want this news suppressed for now, so…”


“No, do as you think would be right.”


“So, an important question? Who will you send to guard the cutie?” Serafall asked.


“I am thinking of contacting Mephisto Pheles. He could send someone under the guise of teaching him magic along with another student. It was the most I could think of without directly disclosing my own interest.”


“Tannin? Although with the Buné Trait, it would be understandable.” Falbium nodded.


“But wouldn’t that disclose the cutie’s information to Mephisto? Although he is not fond of the old devils, wouldn’t it be a risk?”


“I don’t have anyone else. Tannin can station dragons in the area to protect him and they can push it off to making possible relations with the former Dragon King and a Pillar Devil.”


They quieted down in thought. It was Ajuka who broke the silence


“I might know of someone. She would be perfect for the job but she might not be suited as a teacher.”


“Who?”


“Tiamat.”


As prepared as he was for the reply, Sirzechs still found his mouth open slightly.


- Mathias Buné -


Man, that was crazy. Who knew that bitch was even stealing from my stipend?


At least she got what she deserved.


I was a pretty forgiving guy but that bitch tried to kill or rather did kill a child, devil or not doesn’t matter. That’s where I draw the line. She and her fucking husband would get everything they deserved.


I earned quite well for everything too.


But revealing the E Ranked products was a bit of a disappointment. I guess I should have expected better than to get away with hiding information from a fucking Satan.


The second part was me not knowing exactly how big the Zagan name actually was. The change in Sirzechs face and the entire facade slipped for a moment.


I am not that good at reading people, not that I care. Not many people can do that. But my enhanced senses did help me notice the difference a little.


I guess amping up my luck was definitely worth it.


He was actually helping me hide my powers. I know it is for some political reason but this goes on with what I want for myself.


Let them play their political games. I will spend my time farming vegetables.


I took this opportunity to check my Stats once more.


Host: Mathias Buné

Title: The Poor Noble, Pure Blooded Devil, The Farmer

Age: 12 years old. 

Body: E+

Mind: E+

Spirit: D-

Magic: D-

Luck: D-


Skills:


Buné Clan Trait:

Dragon Taming: E

Dragonification: E


Zagan Clan Trait:

Life Magic: E+


Magic:

Teleportation: E+


Farm Management


Farm Rank: D

Farming Points: 76

Money: 20,80,000Ⱡ


Shop


Inventory


My Farming Points looked the lowest I had ever seen them but my money column was beyond what I was hoping to get anytime soon.


The best part however was the box I had in my hands.


A simple wooden box containing my Evil Pieces. And by the Satans, they were stunning.


I even got a Mutation Piece, a bishop, which later made me want to bang my head. I should have gone for the test later on with a much higher Luck Stat. Maybe I could have gotten two or even more Mutation Pieces if that was even possible though.


I just increased my Spirit and Magic Power because I was worried that I would need that in the test. I lucked out however with my set being directly handed to me by Ajuka Beelzebub who came to ask me about my product. I Even found out some interesting things. The products that I grow in my farm cannot be grown by anyone outside. The plants just didn’t grow. They had seeds and everything else was fine. I was happy with this because it meant that no one could stand against me as a competitor in the agriculture industry. They attributed it to my Zagan Clan Trait but I knew better. My Farm System was the best. How can such effects be produced by common people?


I checked my System and the new parts of the D Ranked Farm.


I had been in a bit of a hurry and didn’t check the features of the Farm upgrade.


Apart from the usual unlocked seeds and equipment, the special feature of the D Ranked Farm was the Pet or rather Ranch Feature. It was similar to the Farm System but I needed to buy the eggs or the young beasts and raise them myself. There was also the need to provide food for them and stronger beings needed specific types of food and environments.

I will have to either make or buy places for them to live from the System and looking at some of the animals, I am inclined to say that I will need to buy them.


Oh yeah, another buttload of grinding for me.


I need to grow the feed for these animals first before trying to raise them and thus started another cycle of the grind.


- Interlude -


In a room full of white, two beings sat watching several monitors.


If Mathias had been here, he would have identified one of them as the guy who gave him the System or simply, Paperwork Guy.


“So, that’s the new member you choose.” The other asked.


“Yes. He seemed almost… Refreshing compared to all those wannabes we meet everyday. They still don’t realize that we can read their minds and even see the future and it’s almost funny to sit in front of them, pretending to do paperwork while hearing them cuss at me in their minds while keeping a straight face when I ignore them. Self entitled little brats. This one however… This was the first time someone wished I got a vacation hahahaha. I really had the urge to laugh at the moment, not at the fact that he said it but because he truly meant it.” The Paperwork Guy laughed before picking up a glass from the table in front of them and drinking. “I read his files, a very calm and easygoing and forgiving type of guy who doesn’t like trouble.”


“That was evident when he stopped cursing you only two days after realising what you gave him. He adapted quite quickly and I even felt that he didn’t really hold any malice towards you. At best he wanted to punch your face once and then get back to work. I don’t think he even realized but he had accepted the System already. I know of several people who would have sworn eternal feud against you for such a thing.” He replied before looking at one of the screens. “Another one dead. Do these idiots really think that getting a Gamer System makes them Gods? Thinking with their dicks kills half of them while the other half are killed by their set preconceived notions and in ‘Meta Knowledge’ of the world, that everything will be exactly what they know or think of. What’s even the point of things if all the Worlds are exactly the same? A single fly can make changes to the entire world, a single sperm reaching its destination faster can cause the so called main character to not even be born, completely fucking up the entire world and yet these utter idiots take away major parts of the story while still believing that the so called ‘plots’ in their minds will remain the same.It is frustrating to even think that they believe that there will be a ‘plot’ since the moment they take their first breath in the world. The new kid you chose was at least better in this regard. He never once even bothered with his knowledge of things, only taking them with a heavy grain of salt.”


“Wow, that was a long rant. I take it the guy who died had to do something with it?” The Paperwork Guy sipped the wine.


“He was one of those Gamer System self entitled brats as you call them. Reincarnated in the Naruto world and started acting like he was hot shit, his behaviour pattern changes were noticed and monitored, showed the signs of knowing what he shouldn’t and before he could realize it, he was shipped into the T&I. The couldn’t get past his mental defences due to the Gamer’s Mind, was given a location based cursed seal and when he tried to escape using the ID Create upon waking up, his head burst open and he was eliminated. He didn’t even last a complete week in the world and these people dream about conquering the world making Kaguya a cock-sleeve, a bunch of morons. Just because you got the Gamer System doesn’t make others idiots. Power corrupts and absolute power corrupts absolutely is a lie. Power just brings out the inner you. If that you is an idiot, well, you are screwed.”


“The kid I chose wasn’t the killing type to begin with. He is just one of those kinder ones although I don’t think he will let that hold anyone back, even himself. It is a rare quality that I rarely see in other people.”


“So you gave him the Low-key, Strongest among the Systems.”


“Working yourself up without actually killing and destroying everything would be a fun change of pace. I want to see a Gamer who would create rather than destroy.”


“Hmm, that does sound interesting. I have gotten bored of watching these typical Gamers too. At least this will be far more interesting than the shit I just saw.”


“I hope so too, my friend. Let’s hope that we get a good show out of this one. I would hate to see him die after all.”

This one is different from the ones I write generally. The System will appear much less as the time goes on. I had to do the infodump for everyone to understand how things work. It will not take a major part of the story after the first chapter.

Story 1: Chapter 3

Chapter 3: Test and Years.


________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


- Elias Rimmon -


I walked ahead to the training field in my designated place as I waited for the Demonic Beast to be released.


I wondered what kind of beast it would be. I had no combat experience to speak of and the best case scenario I could think of would be shifting my attributes to sneak in a quick hit at a weak spot.


I did have some spells and even prepared a few in advance. It still depended on what kind of beast I would be facing.


The wait didn’t last long as a magic circle summoned the demonic beast a good distance from me.


The first thing that came to my mind on seeing the beast was… damn, it was ugly.


It looked like a rhinoceros but bigger. Its skin was thick and spiked. Yellow eyes stared at everything around as if waiting for the restraints to disappear to charge forward and crush them under its massive hooves.


“Ready.” I heard the examiner call.


I nodded.


In my mind, I already made a basic plan of attack.


It was a land based demonic beast so take to the sky. That would stop most of its attacks. I don’t know if it can still use ranged attacks so keep a healthy distance to dodge in case I need it.


And as expected, as soon as the beast was released, it charged towards me.


I took to the sky in a moment and shot a volley of spells towards it.


Every spell missed the beast and hit the ground beside it but I couldn’t help but smile.


The very next moment, the ground under it crashed into a deep pit with at least 20 metres depth. The beast roared.


I used the second spell, one that was the most basic spell used by the low class devils.


A spell to create water to fill the hole.


The roars increased in volume and the ground around the pit shook from the beast struggling and hitting the walls.


The roars soon got quiet as it was drowned in the water.


All I needed to do was wait out for a few minutes for it to suffocate and die.


Once done, I looked up and gave a thumbs up to the crowd now looking at the scene with a  deadpan.


I walked towards them and Miss Maya greeted me. “Mr. Rimmon, first of all congratulations. You have passed your second test. Before you take your last test, could you perhaps tell me why you chose the spells you did to take down the Demonic Beast?”


“Because it was the most efficient case. I was told to take down the beast. No methods were mentioned. I wasn’t told if the Demonic Beast would be used after I took it down or not, so I decided to err on the side of caution in case I lost any marks for making a mess and reducing the price of the body. Again, in case it was a case of fighting, I would prefer to keep my more dangerous spells to myself and not exhibit them publicly for show.”


She looked at me for a moment and then nodded. “Very good. Let’s proceed on to the next test. Please show me two spells of your creation. The better the spells, the more the chances of you being picked by a senior magician as a student or even an apprentice, so don't hold back.” she patted my back and I stared at her for a second more than necessary before realising and then quickly nodded.


Apprenticeship. This was not mentioned before.


I did read about this before. Apprentices were treated much better than normal students and given much more resources. They were basically the elites among students.


“What does an Apprenticeship entail?” I asked.


“It will mainly be people reading about your demonstration and deciding if they want to take you as an apprentice. An Apprentice gets better resources than normal students of the same level and are nurtured with a lot more care because they are considered to have more potential. In general, the restrictions that your rank imposes on you for learning things, are far more relaxed if you can become an apprentice of a High Class Magician or if you are lucky, someone even higher.”


This changed things… a lot.


I nodded and went back to the field. Miss Maya waved her hand and targets appeared around the place.


In all this time I had studied mainly Wind Magic.


But even simple wind magic with some basic knowledge of science can give wonderful results.


I looked at the targets in front of me and used the spell I previously made.


Twenty wind bullets formed, spinning in the air like drills.


I waved my hand and the bullets rushed, in a direction far away from the targets.


The bullets whirled past the targets by a large margin but just as everyone thought that the shots were a miss, twenty targets had their heads pierced with bullet holes.


I let a slight smile appear on my face.


Mirage Bullets.


Changing the density of air through heat to bend the light in a way that the real direction of the bullets cannot be seen. It works on the same principle as the formation of mirages in deserts. While that took a very large amount of air to bend the light sufficiently, in this case I had a cheat called Magic.


I looked at the crowd and the lady gave me a nod so I went on to the second spell, which was basically a blatant plagiarism.


“I will need someone to attack me for this next spell. It is a defensive type magic.”


Miss Maya nodded and almost instantly several whirling bullets of wind formed in the air and I found myself with a hung jaw. She copied me.


I however didn’t have much time to think as the bullets shot towards me.


A Magic Circle appeared under my feet and wind spun around me in the form of a sphere/ The bullets stuck the sphere and were deflected instantly. The Spell was inspired from the Hyuga’s Rotation Technique. This however was more of a Counter-Attack Type Magic than a Defensive Type. The sharp winds around me would have shredded anyone to pieces if they had tried to approach me. The consumption was a bit much but it was the best defence I could think of for now.


My Mirage Bullets cannot be dodged by eyesight alone.


Still… Did I invent an already created spell of this woman, or did she copy it with just one look?


Fuck… and she is supposed to be just a High Class Magician.


I remember the anime and Mid Class Magicians seemed to be the type of cannon fodder who everyone and their grandmothers could beat even after waking up from a bad hangover.


Am I really that weak?


Shit.


I went ahead, but no one spoke anything and Miss Maya just instructed me to complete the rest of the exam.


The last part of the Exam was to spar with her for a bit. It was mainly to see if I have the overall abilities and skill of a Low Class Magician.


She walked into the Training Ground in front of me.


“Don’t hold anything back. Although this examination was made in order to avoid you taking any advantage of your Devil Heritage, it still is an advantage. Giving it up would be the utmost level of foolishness so, don’t hold back. Come at me with the intent to kill, with everything you have got.” She said and I nodded.


And right then I felt her magic pour out of her.


I am not able to sense Magic that well. I did get the ability after my own Magic Power and Spirit Stats reached a certain level but… this time I didn’t need to. Wisps of bluish purple magic power appeared around her.


I pushed two hundred points from my Spirit to my Body. I might need to dodge.


Host: Elias Rimmon

Body: 240

Mind: 2,000

Spirit: 2,050

Magic: 400


"Start."


I raced towards Miss Maya several dozen wind bullets forming around me.


The speed this time was much faster as they raced towards her.


I am very sure I saw her smirk before my Wind Shell appeared around her. At the same time, I felt my blood chill as hundreds of wind bullets formed around her. Not ones, not tens but fucking hundreds. I tore off another page of my Grimore, activating another spell which I had plagiarised.


Air Armour. It was used to increase the density of air around the user and change the direction of any light weight projectile shot at the user, including bullets. It just changes the angle of the attack lightly and makes them in a way… slip away from the user.


The Wind Bullets rained towards me, only to slip away from me. I, in the meanwhile, used the next spell.


I created the fucking Wind Shell. I would be a fool to not invent a counter for it.


Two pages of my Grimore were torn and several dozen Wind Bullets formed around me, ready to pour down on her at a moment's notice.


I could see that smile on her face as she raised the Wind Shell again… annoyingly.


This time however, the Wind Bullets were not made to attack her but rather to make her activate the Wind Shell.


Another couple of pages of my Grimore were torn off and a Magic Circle formed around the Wind Shell of Miss Maya.


Nox Out. A spell that changes the nitrogen and oxygen in the atmosphere to Nitrogen Oxide which is poisonous and can knock out the opponent if inhaled in large quantities.


It was mainly used in close spaces… but if my opponent was kind enough to make a bubble of high speed spinning wind around her, who am I to not take advantage of it?


I am not expecting the spell to actually knock her out, just to disorient her a little.


A single moment of lapse in concentration was enough for me to take advantage of.


The bombardment of wind bullets continued for around one minute. I was preparing the next step of my attack in the meantime.


Two spells were set for use.


Bias Release - a wind spell that compresses air in a certain area to great degrees and releases it in one direction. This can be focused to have greater effects.


And, Freezing Wind. Compressing the Nitrogen in the air to high pressures to liquefy it. Liquid Nitrogen can instantly freeze an area reaching sub zero temperatures.


Combine the two spells and I have a Freeze Spray of Instant Death, ready to make a popsicle out of my opponents at a moment's notice.


Magic is like a software used to hack Nature. If we know well enough what to do, the effects of the magic gets enhanced.


Still Magicians use Magic in a very raw form. Making icicles and bombing the opponents with it. How wasteful.


Miss Maya's Wind Shell wavered and I released all my spells almost instantly at her.


A five metre area around her froze over.


Mists covered the entire place and it got difficult to see what had happened to her.


Suddenly, I dodged to the side and the place I was standing on was bombed by what I recognized as my Bias Release.


"The combination was quite good but… don't you have anything better? This much is not good against a High Class Magician." I turned towards the voice to see Miss Maya standing in the air.


She teleported.


I said nothing. The last few spells took a lot of toll on my Demonic Power reserves. I did however use a move to give a reply.


A magic circle formed above me as a ball of compressed and spinning wind formed, slowly turning into a shuriken made up of wind.


She merely stood in her place and watched me use the spell.


I again waved my hand and the huge spinning ball of death rushed towards the biggest target and showed everyone on the training ground why Naruto Uzumaki could sail through the entire ninja war with just a single technique and its variations.


The Rasenshuriken's attack struck true. The rocks around her looked as if vapourized. In a way it was true because this attack worked on the cellular level. The only problem with it was the energy required for this. Three Rasenshurikens took almost all of my Demonic Power as a Mid Class Devil. There was also the fact that the attack required a few seconds to prepare and form completely.


That said, I am pretty sure that anyone, any Mid Class Devil, if hit by this attack would suffer.


I fell to my knees. This spell took out almost all of my Demonic Power and I didn't want to shift my attributes to give them any hints about my power. If my Demonic Power suddenly increased, it would be suspicious to say the least.


I saw Berta and Aaron gasping at the attack. It had taken me a lot of work to get the required balance for this particular skill but hopefully this gets me the much needed apprenticeship.


"Now, that was something decent."


I heard her voice, just as nonchalant as a second ago from between the dust cloud. A gust of wind blew the dust cloud away and there she stood… Completely unharmed.


Are High Class Magicians… really this strong?


The motherfucking anime and Light Novels lied to me.


I mean sure, I was hiding my power but still… I was using the stats of a Mid Class Devil to fight her.


She must have sensed my thoughts from my expressions, not that it was hard to do so because for a moment I had stopped giving shit, because she spoke. "Your power reached a solid Mid Class Level with that attack. Too bad your Demonic Power and Strength needs a lot more training. Your Magic on the other hand was… adequate."


I sat on the ground trying to gather myself.


She continued. "Just for a demonstration, this is what a High Class Magician can do."


She raised a hand towards the empty part of the field. A Magic Circle appeared in front of her hand and almost instantly a hurricane rose in the middle of the ground, almost reaching the sky. The sheer sight of the attack was awe inspiring as well as depressing. But, she wasn't done yet. Just when I thought it was over, the entire hurricane was frozen… instantly.


I felt a chill on my back as I watched the scene.


"A High Class being can destroy a village. An Ultimate Class being can destroy cities and provinces. A Leader Class or what you call a Satan Class being can destroy countries. Do not think for a single moment that you are strong just because you have gained some strength. Pride comes before the fall is a very good saying for an obvious reason. Your performance was passable. You will get your detailed results in a week as well as the information about any apprenticeship if you do get accepted by someone. For now, I declare you a Low Class Magician. Congratulations on passing, Mr. Rimmon."


"I… thank you." I answered slightly absentmindedly, still looking at the gigantic frozen hurricane in the middle of the training ground. My Rasenshuriken was nothing compared to that. None of my attacks were anything compared to that Spell, not even close.


I took a deep breath and slapped my cheeks and got up.


Isn't this just the High Class Level?


I started training a year ago and now I am a Mid Class being all by myself. A few more years. I will reach there.


With this thought in mind, I got up and bowed to Miss Maya and went to Aaron who gave me a light hug and patted my back with a smile while congratulating me.


Berta had a slightly complicated look on her face. She still nodded and congratulated me.


But didn't stay behind for long as she went behind Miss Maya to escort her to the mansion.


Aaron gave me a check up and led me to my room where I fell asleep as soon as I laid on the bed.


– Medea –


Medea watched as Aaron entered the room and bowed slightly. "How is he?"


"Elias is completely unharmed, Lady Medea. Perhaps a little exhausted but still unharmed." She watched him hesitate a little before gathering his courage and opening up. "My Lady, he…"


"Are you worried about him even after seeing his performance, Aaron?"


"I… I don't understand this."


"Geniuses are rarely understood. And my gem… He might as well be the one who gives the term genius a new definition. Did you see his performance? The spells he created, with only months of self-study. How many others do you know who can achieve the same level of skill in Magic?"


"I… . didn't even know what some of those spells were or how they worked. I could do similar spells, at least the ice magic but others, I have no idea how they worked" Aaron said after a while and then looked at Berta who shook her head as well.


"Because those spells were not brute forced. You could use the ice magic, but it would take you around 12 times more Demonic Power to achieve the same results. He was using science rather than mysticism, working within the laws of nature rather than against it to achieve the results which greatly reduced his Demonic Power expenditure. Most of his spells were using nature to enhance their power. Thus, you couldn't have copied the spell or done anything even on the same level without knowing the underlying principle. Even I myself couldn't copy his last spell. It was far more complicated than it looked at a simple glance."


"Yes. That last attack… it could have destroyed most High Class Devils easily."


"It could have done the same for most Ultimate Class Devils had they been caught off guard and there was more power behind the spell. Even the famed regeneration of the Phenex would have been challenged. That attack was not a single one but rather an uncountable number of small blades attacking the body continuously at the cellular level. Add the flames that the Phenex release during regeneration and the wind attribute of the attack would have made the attack even more dangerous."


She analysed the spell from behind her barrier and got some information about it.


And to think that he was still holding back… She smiled with sheer anticipation.


Keeping his cards till it was a matter of life and death. It was an admirable quality. Something that someone in his position would need to survive. She will get him to open up… in time.


Trust was not earned so easily after all. She of all people understood this fact.


They kept quiet on hearing the news. The one to break the silence was Berta.


"What do we do from now on, My Lady?"


"Nothing. You will all maintain the illusion about him being a Mid Class Devil at best. I will teach him personally and let him flourish his talents as much as he can."


"Yes, My Lady."


She noticed a slight hesitation on Berta's face. She has really grown close to her Gem.


"You are not cheating him, Berta. Rather you are doing this to keep him safe. Children of his talents are either recruited or killed. Not to mention if he finds out about his power, he might get cocky. You are just doing what any responsible guardian would do to keep him out of trouble. After all, mothers scaring their child with imaginary monsters and such to keep them from doing mischief is not something new."


Except this time, the monsters would be very real.


- Elias -


I woke up from my sleep and looked around my room, only to fall back after remembering yesterday.


The frozen hurricane at the end of the test was something that had been imprinted on my mind.


I looked at my Status screen to see the current level of my stats.


Host: Elias Rimmon

Body: 240

Mind: 2,000

Spirit: 2,050

Magic: 400


I shifted my stats around for the grinding mode.


I was only learning magic for a few months now and it was just my start. The frozen hurricane might be impressive but one day I will surpass it.


For now I just need to keep on training.


Host: Elias Rimmon

Body: 40

Mind: 500

Spirit: 4,000

Magic: 150


The Spirit stat as I observed, increases my Magic Stat passively. From my guesses, I could deduce that the stronger someone’s soul, the more their magic grows naturally. The greater the difference between my Spirit and Magic stats, the faster the growth and thus when I am not training or studying, I always keep my Spirit Stat at a high level.


For the same amount of magic training, there can be drastically different results for my growth in Magic Stat, depending on the spirit. I guess, the ones with great talent and such must have very High Spirit Stat and such.


I got up to get fresh for my training.


- Two Years Later -


Three years have passed since my test.


Three days after my test, I got my results formally. I was accepted in the Gauzaburer’s Magician’s Organisation as a Low Class Magician.


Surprisingly, I got a mentor as well.


Miss Maya took me in as an apprentice.


She told me that while she won’t be taking me with her all the time, she would come every month to keep an eye on my studies and the rest were books.


The books.


I have a large shelf full of books in my room all as a courtesy from Miss Maya.


Everything I would need to study up to the Mid Class level. It also contained some books about other schools of magic such as the Norse and the Greek ones.


Miss Maya did as she promised me and came every month and stayed for a few days in the mansion and taught me Magic.


My personal favourite was still the one I started with, The Human Magic System or the Merlinean Magic System.


It was quite a lot like programming and I remembered a Light Novel Series from my previous life which served as a massive inspiration for my Magic.


The Irregular at Magic High School.


There was a big reason for it too.


The way in which the Merlinean System approached Magic was very slightly reminiscent of that one. The Human Magic System had many types too. The ones Merlin created was just the base or rather the first one of its kind. Later on many others took it and made other styles of magic of their own.


It was kinda like having different programming languages to do the same thing.


Many famous magicians had invented their own programming languages for Magic. These were people who created Magician Organisations basically. People like McGregor Mathews and Rudriger Rozencrutz.


My stats had grown a lot in these two years. It was mainly due to the help of Miss Maya and my newest spell.


A Wide Area Gravity Concentration Spell, Gravity Field.


I could understand why they said that Gravity Manipulation was High Class Stuff.


Manipulating one of the fundamental forces is something else.


The spell has to be powered continuously by my Demonic Power. It had a great energy requirement too.


The gravity worked on my entire body at the same time and was much more effective than the weights had been.


A rough calculation showed that they were almost twice as effective.


The hardest part about the spell however was the control required over it. The fluctuating input changed the output accordingly too so to keep a stable gravitational field, the user had to keep a stable input as well, which, believe me, is easier said than done.


Well, no. It can be done easily but my mentor advised me not to.


According to her, if I was doing this to train myself, I should not add the component to regulate the power.


This will help me improve my control over my Demonic Power.


The ones with shitty Magic Circles like me can use this method to close the gap, even if only slightly. I thought about it for a moment and it made sense.


The difficulty though… I think my mentor might be a closet sadist.


To put it into words, it was like running an obstacle course with a mad Demonic Beast chasing me while I had to balance a pot of burning lava on my head.


I couldn’t make a stable field for two months straight.


The training though… It helped all my stats grow simultaneously.


The strain from the concentration needed to maintain the stable Gravity field, increased both Mind and Spirit. The push ups in the Gravity field increased my Body and the drain on my Magic to maintain the Gravity Field, increased my Magic Stat.


It was the best training someone like me could get.


The results showed this.


I gain around 6 Stat Points from this method… every hour.


Currently, I can keep this up for eight hours before fainting but it still nets me 48 points in those eight hours alone.


Host: Elias Rimmon

Body: 2,000

Mind: 7,000

Spirit: 29,230

Magic: 3,500


Although she is a slave driver, Miss Maya is a great teacher..


Like seriously, I thought I was training hard enough but this woman made my previous training look like a child playing around.


Once I faint from the above training, it takes me around eight hours to wake up. Although, now my body has been getting used to it more.


After I wake up, she follows it by a spar which is a polite word for a beatdown.


She used spells created by me in spars mostly so whenever I made a spell, I made it a habit to make counters for them or at least a way to defend against them.


Later on, she started using her own spells. Magic from several different styles and schools randomly thrown at me.


One second, I would be dodging summoned demonic spirits, the next second I would be dodging Runic traps on the ground.


Although, not everything was bad.


First things first. She’s hot.


She is probably the prettiest woman I have seen in both my lives. I mean Devils are beautiful in general but she is still above the common rabble.


Blue hair and elf like slightly pointed ears. She told me that she was a reincarnated Devil who was under the Lucifuge House and was originally from Greece. Although she didn’t tell me the details of anything, even this much was quite a lot.


Second, after the training is done, she adores me.


Like, ,really adore me.


For example, whenever I faint, I get lap pillows from her.


At the end of the training, we take baths together.


And outside of training, she never let me go anywhere from her lap. Although my cheeks are poor. And while that was good when I was nine, with my rapidly growing body and puberty, things are not that simple for me anymore. Not that she minded it. She was quite free when with me.


See did seem a little crazy but hey….every worth their salt is a bit crazy. Moreover….she’s a Devil Magician. And if that was not enough….she’s Greek.


Recently, she told me that my Demonic Power is barely at the High Class level, although my skills need a lot more work but were average in the Mid Class level.


3,500 Magic is barely High Class.


At least, three and a half years in, I am now near the High Class level. She still couldn’t take me out of the Underworld though because apparently I still needed to clear the Mid Class Devil Promotion exams. It sucked but that exam was in a year. I am pretty sure I could make it to the mid levels or even the peak of High Class.


I also found out something very interesting. Berta was as strong as a High Class Devil. Although only at the starting stage but still.


In hindsight, it made sense with how she had kicked my ass back in the day.


It also gave me a measure of how strong a real High Class Devil can be. The maids were all Mid Class Devils and only Berta was stronger as the Head Maid. I did spar with some maids and while they were not very good fighters, their base stats were more or less around 1,000 or so.


In Devil Society, children were allowed to take some responsibilities after they became twelve. I’m twelve but due to my regular training, I passed for a fifteen year old. This allowed me several leeways. One such thing was exploring the city.


I often went out for walks around the city. Sometimes even disguising myself to listen to others.


The Underworld was a lot like the Human World in many aspects. It also had a dark side. Criminal gangs and a Black Market.


Surprisingly, these were maintained and backed up by the Pillar Houses and Extra Demon Houses.


These Black Markets had things that wouldn’t see the light of the day normally and even if it did, would not be sold to just anyone, like rare materials, books, equipment, artifacts and even Magic Circles.There were auctions which sold these things. In fact, from the rumours many rare things like Phenex Tears were also sold.


While my Human Magic was progressing very well, I was still far behind in my Devil Magic. It was after all a part of me and I would be a fool to not utilise it


The greatest drawback for me to learn Devil Magic would be my Magic Circle. A normal 20% efficiency Magic Circle would cost me all my savings and would still leave me at least four times behind any Pillar Devil who normally has at least 80% efficiency Magic Circles.


That means, I would need at least 8,000 Magic Stat to be able to barely match the energy expenditure of a barely passable High Class Devil. And that’s not even mentioning the other facilities of a High Level Magic Circle like the spell storage, high casting speed, etc.


Just the thought of it was depressing. The only way to bypass those are these Black Markets.


That said, I would be getting nothing if I went in as I was now. I didn’t have the money for it.


There were ways of earning money though.


These places posted several tasks like collection of materials to the likes of killing someone. I am obviously not taking any of these jobs right now but… I will have to take them after my exams.


I visited the Blacksmith’s shop regularly after that. The lady was quite bored and talked to me when she was free. I got to know many things from her.


The hunters to the pits earned a pretty decent amount of money.


Unlike other territories, this territory under Grayfia Lucifuge was near the borders and the pits.


It was a dangerous place but it also meant that anything and everything that came out of the Pits was the property of Grayfia Lucifuge. However she allowed the people of her territory to hunt near the pits and sell off the things. There was obviously a tax on it to maintain the territory.


But apart from that, even the Mid Class Demonic Beasts from the Pits were priced to 40 million Liliums depending on the variety they were.


Not to mention, they collect materials from the pits.


There was also a specific team of Devil under her who helped clear out the Demonic Beasts near the pits so which cannot be handled by weaker Devils. This group needed members to be at the very least at High Class level.


The best part about this was that I didn’t have to officially become a member of anyone’s peerage to do so. I can just get contracts and in time become a High Class Devil by myself.


I found out about this from my teacher who is also in charge of one of these teams.


This is my plan to collect money for my research of magic. I wanted to join this team.


My final goal, make a Magic Circle for Human Magic. Kinda like the CAD’s from the Mahouka to store my spells and cast them at a moment’s notice. For this, I need to thoroughly study several Magic Circles.


As I was thinking of these things, there was a knock on my door and I heard a maid’s voice outside.


Miss Maya was back for my classes again.


I was already ready and thus left quickly.


Today however I was led to the mansion instead.


____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


I entered the mansion to find Miss Maya sitting, being served by Berta. She was however not alone.


Along with her sat the same Purple haired, orange eyed girl who changed my life with just a few words.


Ingvild Leviathan.


There was another person beside them. I found myself taking a slight breath in.


She was stunning.


Grey hair, red eyes and looks that could freeze the atmosphere with just a look.


Her power seemed to be coiled around her tightly, not a hint being released and yet, it could be felt around her, in her presence.


Grayfia Lucifuge.


“Elias! Pay respect to them.” Aaron whispered quickly beside me, making me realise that I was just staring.


I quickly gave them a bow and greeted them.


She nodded while Ingvild looked at me with a light smile. “How have you been, Elias?”


“Thanks to you, I have been well, My Lady. Everyone here has treated me well and takes good care of me. Thank you.” I bowed lightly.


“That’s good to hear.” She smiled.


“Elias.” Miss Maya interrupted the conversation, looking at me. “We are going to have a spar. Consider it a surprise test. I want you to give it your all. No bars held. Don’t hold back like you always do. Is that understood?”


I was taken aback for a moment before I stood up straight and nodded. “Yes Teacher.”


“Good. Then go to the training fields.”


I was led out by a maid while having different thoughts in mind.


Is she trying to give me an opportunity to demonstrate my talents for those two?


I did talk to her about some ways to earn money for my Magic Research and she told me that she will see what she can do and now this…


Well… the least I can do is give them a good show.


- Medea -


Ingvild was taken aback as soon as Elias’s spar was announced. She held it back but only till he was out of the room.


“Lady Medea, what is the meaning of this?”


“What else would it mean, Ingvild? I have been teaching a student and I want to see his progress.”


“But Elias!”


“Is a Genius beyond compare. I estimate that by the time he is of age, he would be a Satan Class being at the very least. It would be such a waste to let his talents go unexplored.”


“Ingvild.” Grayfia spoke this time. “It’s fine. Medea doesn’t mean any harm. If anything, she cares more about the boy than anyone else in this place.”


Ingvild’s surprise quietened her for a while and she explained the details about Elias to her, obviously leaving some of her plans for her gem aside.


“The boy however is too noble for his own good. He refuses to take anything he hasn’t earned because he thinks of it as taking advantage of us who are doing so much for him. This makes it hard to give him any extra support without being suspicious. He’s also stubborn. He can bow to others in gratitude, no matter who they are but he won’t bow to anyone in servitude. I know him enough to know these things about him. I just want to provide a way for him to grow.”


The boy is also cautious. Despite growing closer to her, he never once spoke about his powers or showed more than a normal growth to anyone. A worthy trait.


Trust is not something that should be given around so easily.


That said, if he kept on hiding his powers, he would only end up stunting his growth.


Thus, she wants to provide a way for him to learn.


Moreover, she wanted him closer to her King.


Grayfia had been a little emotional since the news of the birth of the son of Sirzechs Lucifer came out, a few days ago.


The traitor was living a happy life while she suffered alone despite all her sacrifices. It pained her.


Not the fact that a child was born… rather her own situation.


She took this opportunity to convince her to watch her testing Elias, in the hopes of having her take an interest in him. It worked.


Grayfia, who was looking for something to distract herself, followed her to meet her protege.


Now, all that was needed was for Elias to show his power.


They teleported directly to the training ground.


The situation was quite similar to two years ago when he took that Low Class magician Examination.


Oh, the examination was actually valid.


She was a member of the Gauzaburer’s Magician Organisation. The Vice Head, to be precise.


Mephisto was quite accommodating after knowing her identity and it helped her recruit talents for her King. She helped him establish the Organisation at a whole new level.


Getting a child be named as a Magician, even a High Class one was a no effort task for her.


Elias was marked as a Mid Class Magician at the age of nine. Only his records were sealed by her and the only ones to know about him were her and Mephisto.


They had already put several barriers around the place because while he thought of himself as someone at the top of High Class, he was easily an Ultimate Class Devil with a Satan Class Soul. And this was not even considering his Magical Abilities in the Human Magic System.


“Are you ready, Elias?” She asked him again.


He nodded and she smiled. Then she attacked.


- Elias -


My heart almost jumped into my mouth when I saw her attacking.


She wasn’t holding back.


The entire sky was covered with magic circles as they were ready to fire blasts from all angles at once.


I quickly transferred my stats to my body and mind, readjusting myself to be able to dodge everything.


Host: Elias Rimmon

Body: 5,000

Mind: 8,000

Spirit: 25,230

Magic: 3,500


And then I momentarily closed my eyes before opening them once more, only this time the entire scenery around me had changed completely.


This is an ability I just awakened when my Spirit Stat crossed 25,000.


It was also the main reason why I was using the Mahouka System of Magic as a reference.


It was because this ability reminded me of something from that world.


Elemental Sight.


The ability to see the Information Realm.


My ability was eerily similar. I could see the entire world in terms of information. What Magic did was tamper with this information to create changes. The problem however was that they didn’t know where or what exactly the information was and could only make pointed guesses. This resulted in them using a lot of Magical Power.


What we underestimate is just how much this wastage is.


Even for someone like Miss Maya, according to my calculations, she wastes around two thousand four hundred times more energy than necessary.


With time, a Magician can estimate the information through more practice and experience leading them to control the power much better.


For a Magician like me, it was the best possible thing I could get.


I could see the invocation of a spell and attack a part of it to destabilise and break it easily.


I can also study the flow of Magic and the formation of the spell and copy it perfectly, although I could do the same with Magic Circles. It’s just that I need a basic Magic Circle as a cover up before I can do such a thing. The scope of what I could do with it was just boundless.


This skill had an insane range as well.


The only problem was that I needed to keep my Spirit Stat above 25,000 at all times to keep it usable.


Not much of a sacrifice if you ask me.


I stamped the ground under my feet, crushing it under me and creating a small crater as I rushed forward.


My eyes were already predicting the areas where the spells will hit and my Air Armour, protecting me against small attacks.


Her magic Circles were tracking my body heat and thus the next spell.


A wide area Oscillation Spell, Inferno.


My grimore’s page was torn and the spell came to life as I injected my Magic into it.


The spell caused a massive inferno around her, disorienting the Magic Circles targeting ability making it go haywire.


- Grayfia -


“She’s not holding back. He’s just a child, Grayfia.” She heard Ingvild’s voice but didn't shift her attention from the fight in front of her.


Over the last three years, she had her ears filled with the abilities of her bishop’s so-called Gem and now she was getting to see the said abilities first hand.


“It’s fine. Medea knows his abilities best. She will not hurt him.” She assured Ingvild although she was a bit doubtful internally. The attack she just used was used in wars against entire squadrons of enemies. It was not something one would use on a single person, let alone a child, no matter how talented.


Her next thoughts were all halted when the entire area around Medea turned into an inferno as the child… or whatever he was blasted over the ground at a pace that would make even Ultimate Class Devils do a back take with nothing but pure physical force.


The attacks rained around the entire ground for a while before Medea dispelled the Magic Circles.


The next second the area around them froze, putting out all the fire.


Mist covered the entire area before she heard a crash.


Huge chunks of ice were thrown towards Medea which she easily dodged but soon after, she saw the mists twisting and a sharp sound of wind from several areas of the mists.


Medea cast a strong wind spell, blowing away the mists, only two find white coloured balls of wind approaching her with a shrill sound.


The attack hit the ground as Medea dodged with a short ranged teleport to land on top of a giant piece of ice as the attack struck the ground she was at, shredding the entire area into pieces.


The ice and earth looked as if vapourized under that attack and the fifty metres area around the place was rendered clean.


Medea had spotted the boy and fired a barrage of spells once more towards the child as he erected a barrier while weaving a spell of his own.


"Standing still in a battle? I thought I beat that habit out of you Elias?"


The spells got concentrated on the barrier tearing it apart. The boy's eyes widened as he dodged the barrage but still got caught in the shockwave, throwing him away.


Ingvild shifted worriedly beside her and even Grayfia was a little moved.


Medea on the other hand looked unphased.


"Come on. I know, an attack of such level won't hurt you directly, let alone from a shockwave. Stop pretending."


And just as she stated, the boy disappeared from his place in a haze.


An illusion?


No… a mirage.


He appeared directly under the place Medea was standing and froze her in a cube of ice till her neck, breathing heavily on his knees.


The match seemed as if it was over but Grayfia knew otherwise.


The Medea in the ice cube melted in shadows and another Medea appeared behind the boy.


“Interesting. But do you really think I would be caught so easily, Elias? I find your lack of faith in me… hurtful.”


“On the contrary, teacher. I am going to win this exactly because I trusted you to dodge it.”


Runes appeared all around the two and Medea’s magic frizzled out as she got stuck to the ground.


The boy on the other hand disappeared.


Grayfia spread her senses around and this time felt him at the source of the seals, under the ground.


He came out, a distance away from Medea and looked at her.


Medea was actually too stunned to speak for a few moments before she laughed. She laughed. “Well done, my little gem. Well done indeed. But you put so much faith in me. How would it look if I didn’t measure up to it.”


Her Demonic Power rose. She stopped holding anything back and everything around her started to crumble.


The boy jumped back quickly as he looked in awe.


“This is what an Ultimate Class being feels like when they get serious, Elias.”


Grayfia had the urge to roll her eyes. This level of power would make most Ultimate Class beings cry and run away in fear. Medea was one of the few Satan Class Reincarnated Devils in the Underworld and now she was using her full power just to break a seal against a twelve year old. She did remember telling Medea to keep the boy humble lest he gets in over his head and get killed but still… this is too much.


“Ultimate Class?”


“Yes. I got promoted two weeks ago. And congratulations. For being able to force me into such a situation, you proved yourself as well. By my authority, I promote you to Mid Class Magician. Congratulations.”


Ingvild looked at her with utter disbelief at the statements while the boy himself seemed overjoyed with the situation.


“Grayfia… What is she talking about? How is Elias a Mid Class Magician? That level of skill… he’s clearly at an Ultimate Class. I didn’t even notice several of the spells between them or how and when they were casted. He’s clearly much above…”


“A Mid Class Magician who’s barely into the High Class. I know. But it’s better that he doesn’t know about it yet. Children can get overconfident easily and could get themselves into trouble. This is even more so due to his situation. You know how much danger he would be in if his powers were discovered by others. There won’t be any negotiations and he would become a target of elimination immediately. Medea is understating his powers to prevent just that from happening.”


"But… . "


"We will tell him everything when he passes the Mid Class Devil exams next year. He will be strong enough to protect himself by then and also make a choice."


Ingvild looked a little unsatisfied but agreed nonetheless.


They watched as both the teacher and student fought with each other till the student collapsed.


– Elias –


I woke up on the familiar lap of my hot teacher.


She never takes it easy on me during the spars. That said, when it's over, she dotes on me like no one else.


"That was quite an impressive performance, my Gem. Your counter attack was very great. It was on the level of a new High Class being. Congratulations."


I knew this tone of hers. It was when I could laze around and act a little spoiled.


So, I took full advantage of the situation and hugged her waist, snuggling into her lap a little more as she giggled lightly. "I really thought that I was going to win this time."


"I had to up my training so that I don't get left behind by you. My Student is too talented and so I am also working hard."


“You didn’t tell me that you were taking an Ultimate Class Examination.” It totally caught me off guard. I mean, sure I was happy that she became an Ultimate Class Magician and even promoted me to a Mid Class one without taking an exam but still…. It came out of nowhere.


“I didn’t because I wanted to surprise you. You surprised me more so I guess we are even.”


We talked about random things for a while.


"Elias, you are now of passable strength to join the hunting teams under the Lucifuge House. I have a team of my own. Would you like to join us? I have talked to Lady Grayfia and she has agreed to this. She was quite impressed by your talents and decided to support you. You can decide what to do for your future when you pass the Mid Class Devil examination. You will not be forced to stay there if you don't want to."


… . 


… . 


"Okay."


” I replied. It was the best part I can think of for now.


Free training and real life experience for someone like me. Not to mention a chance to earn enough money and make connections for the future.


_________________________________x_____________________________________________________________________x____________________________________


Beta Reader: LuluViBritania(FF.N, SB, WN and QQ)/-LuluViB|99th Britannian Emperor(Discord)

Author’s Note:


Another chapter of Story 1 after a long time.


Elias is in the upper ranks of the World and he doesn’t even know.


Medea is a ruthless teacher and an equally awesome waifu.


I had to do the time skip or it would have slowed the already slow progression a lot.


I mean, there was nothing much to be added.


Elias is a cautious guy, one of the reasons why he doesn’t question anything is because it is in line with his goal of becoming stronger.


In fact, Elias also takes an initiative to hide some power of his own. He always states his power and even performs one level lower than his normal powers as he keeps most of his stats in Mind and Spirit.


Add this with Medea’s deception and we get an MC who is two levels stronger than he thinks himself to be.


The Elemental Eyes from Mahouka is Elias’ original ability. The Original Ability or Clan Trait that Elias has awakened.


It requires the Spirit Stat to remain above 25,000 for now but it will improve slowly and become permanent.


We will be seeing many of the Mahouka Abilities as Elias will be working on it.


After all, Sirzechs has got nothing on the One True Onii-sama, Godsuya.


Some might have noticed that Milicas was born much earlier than we know. What changes will that cause and how will the world be affected by it?


Enjoy the new chapter.


Good Day, Peace Out.

title: Story 1: Chapter 2: Learning Magic
content:
Disclaimer: I own nothing.


Chapter 2: Learning Magic.

__________________________________________________________________________

- Elias Rimmon -

Three months in, I have completed my primary education and have joined a preparatory course for the Mid Class Devil promotion.


Berta had looked at me with an odd expression when I told her that I wanted to get admitted in one, but that was much better than when I had asked her to give me permission to sit for the examination for the Primary Examination Certificate. She hasn't said a word to me but had taken me to my room and prepared a few sets of questions for me.


I noticed that the level of the questions were far above what may have appeared for the examination but didn't complain. Putting almost all my stats to Mind Stat was already cheating enough. I didn't want to be a little bitch about something she was doing for my own good even if she was not required to do so. I had aced the examination in a quarter of the time. For the next paper, Berta sat in front of me and stared at me like a bird of prey while I wrote the answers. It was a bit distracting so I took longer to write this one… A full three minutes longer. 


She had checked the paper, twice, and then merely sat there without saying anything. 


This time however she didn't say a word and got me admitted to the examination the very next day. No questions asked. 


That very night, Dr. Aaron came over with a cake for me. It was both to celebrate my completing the Primary Studies and… My birthday. 


I was officially 9 years old. 


This was also the day I found just where I was in the timeline in this world, for today was also the first birthday of the Heiress of the Gremory, the one year old, Rias Gremory. 


Now one may wonder how I found out about it, when that house's name was a minor taboo of sorts in the mansion. Well TV is a wonderful invention. 


In seventeen years give or take a few months was when shit hits the fan… . or doesn't in this world, I would rather err on the side of caution. 


Aaron was very happy with my progress in his Magic Lessons and gave me a certain something I wasn't even expecting. 


It was a book on Magic, or to be more precise, a book on Human Magic.


He said that he knew some people in Mephisto Pheles' Magician Organization and it was easy to have a copy made for me.


Devils were disdainful of the Human Magic System because one needed to work for this. I mean why would anyone do complex maths and calculations to do something that you can just imagine and use some Demonic Power to achieve. 


This is why even if there were restrictions for Devil Magic and Magic Circles, there was no such thing for Human Magic. 


It was actually one of the best although nigh impossible things I could get for myself. 


I hugged the man for a full minute.


He explained the origin of the system of magic that the book he gave me belonged to. There were many systems of magic in this world. She had then gone off and explained how training with weights without proper supervision could be dangerous and then called Aaron and had him explain to me the proper ways of using the weights.


She might have reasoned that she was doing so only because she didn’t want to answer Miss Ingvild if something happened to me under her care but I could see that she actually cared. It was hard not to develop some sort of bond between people when you see mostly each other for eleven months now and we were starting to warm up to each other.


I still hid my stats though and my power but now I needed to reveal more to show that my training was actually working, the reason being Aaron regularly checking me for any health problems.


And let me tell you guys… my training speed soared with just a bit of proper guidance. It was the difference between someone who ran by themselves and a professional athlete who was being trained for the Olympics. The difference would be massive.


The second part was, the Magic.


I very well couldn’t practice Magic inside my room or the house.


I needed to try out the spells outside. I had considered trying it when outside the house but gave up on that idea remembering the place we were in.


I had to practice Magic outside in the garden near my room and that was easily visible to others. The maids of the house often took a look at my practice, especially Berta. I did get introduced to a few of them and they were all Mid Class or above, trained professionals.


While I did gain some favours due to my now adorable looks, it was all normal things like candies and snacks.


My practice in Magic however was noticed by Aaron who offered me a chance to get admitted to Gauzaberer Magicians Organisation if I wanted to.


I was ecstatic at the news. There was a catch like everything else. I was a Low Class Devil and the Gauzaberer Magician Organisation was in the human world which meant I couldn’t go there till I was a Mid Class Devil. Although there was a side route. If I impressed Mephisto Pheles, I could probably gain a favour from him and be sponsored to attend.


Mephisto Pheles was an Ultimate Class Devil and taking me to the Human World to be a part of the organisation wouldn’t be much of a problem for him.


This however required me to do extremely well in my Magical Studies and become a Mid Class Magician by the age of twelve because that seemed to have been the record.


If that was the case, someone could take me in as an apprentice.


As such I could prepare. He had offered to call his friend for a favour if I showed promise in Magic to arrange for more books for me. I agreed and even paid for the price for the extra books despite Aaron’s reluctance. I already owed the man a lot. Taking even more seemed unfair and thus my insistence to pay the cost myself.


I got a couple of books on magic the next day itself and this time they were paid for by me.


To become a Mid Class Magician, I have to take their examination or be referred to the organisation by a qualified Ultimate Class Magician or four High Class Magicians. They don't usually go easy in these tests because the referrals count as their contribution to the organisation allowing them to earn points for themselves.


As for the Ultimate Class Magicians, no one would care if they got a simple Mid Class Magician in.


According to him, when I pass the Low Class Magician examination, I will have to hire a tutor for myself.


My Stats have grown smoothly since I got the training weights. My natural growth of Magic Stat had also increased and further enhanced due to the daily training in Magic. I had substituted my extra Meditation time to Magic Training as the gain speed was much faster. My stats grew to a respectable range now. 


Host: Elias Rimmon

Body: 40

Mind: 2,000

Spirit: 2,250

Magic: 400


The only problem I was encountering was not knowing my exact strength.


The Preparatory Classes didn't teach any magic or fighting skills. So I could hardly see anyone fighting. 


There was also the fact that I knew nothing about fighting. I could just cast spells and I had recently learned how to make Grimoires and use them to spam my spells but I had no knowledge of any martial arts or how magical fights usually happened.


I also had no solid idea what range of stats represented what power levels. 


My only knowledge came from Berta's comments according to whom, 400 was barely a Mid Class Level.


I once had a thought of pushing my magic power to overpower my training weights and measuring if my Stats were upto the level of a High Class Devil but I gave up on that thought because I had grown attached to the weights and… I didn’t know how strong the explosion would be.


Curiosity killed the Cat is a very famous saying after all. Unfortunately satisfaction would not restore my blown up weights, refund my money or hide the fact I managed to somehow gain enough demonic power to blow them up in the first place.


So I had to keep my curiosity in check for now and believe 400 to be the Mid Class Devil’s starting range. According to that, I was slightly a Mid Class Level in all of my stats even if they were distributed equally. Above that is still a mystery.


Today was the day I wanted to attempt my first exam for the Rank of a Low Class Magician.


It consisted of four parts. There were some slight changes in the rules for me because I was a Devil and had an innate advantage in Magic so an extra part was added.


Spell Creation.


I had to show two spells of my own creation. As long as it is a Low Level Spell, I will get a pass.


The tests were, a written test, demonstration of two spells of my own creation, subduing or killing a Low Level Demonic Beast and finally spar with the examiner.


A Low Level Demonic beast was a mindless wild animal with Demonic Power and a normal Low Level Magician is expected to easily subdue or kill such a thing. The spar was for extra credits.


Soon enough I was called by another one of the maids to the examination venue which was the other side of the mansion.


In the venue, I could see Berta and Aaron along with another person. This woman had a cloak with black and gold, completely hiding the upper part of her face. I could only see her lips with a purple lipstick on them.


I guess this is my examiner.


“Elias, come and say hello to your examiner. This is Miss Maya, a High Class Magician from the Gauzaberer Organisation. She will be your examiner for this exam and your mentor if you pass this exam.” Aaron told me.


- Interlude -

- Berta -


Berta watched as the boy sat for the exams.


She had very complex thoughts about the boy from the first day when she was told that someone will be living in the mansion by Lady Ingvild. Berta had avoided all contact with everyone outside the mansion because of her fear of losing them. She knew this much without anyone else pointing it out to her, although she didn’t lack of being pointed out by her stupid brother, Aaron. Thus, this was a shock for her when she was told to temporarily take care of a child, a boy nonetheless.


Aaron had taken a shine to the little boy with amnesia, probably projecting his own child on him. After all they were in a very similar situation, one lost his parents and the other his child, but she had maintained her distance.


She wasn’t mentally as strong as Aaron.


The child however made it hard to hate him or even dislike him no matter how much she wanted to keep away. He had been perfectly obedient, always studying or training while hiding. She scoffed at the attempts of the child.


Each maid of the house was recruited after a very harsh test and were all Mid Class Devils… at the time of their recruitment. They were however put under hard training so that each of them were pushed to a High Class level within five years of recruitment. Any Pillar Devil would have lost their minds at the sheer force present in just one of her mansions. Lady Grayfia wasn’t afraid of anyone rebelling from their side because unlike other Pillar Devils, she never gave anyone a reason to do so, and… she was too strong to worry about mere High Class Devils.


She monitored the child for the signs of anything amiss, lest he be a spy and while she found many inconsistencies from normal children, she could be sure of one thing and that was that the boy was not a spy. This fact was only confirmed when Lady Medea had questioned him under her spells, and verified his identity herself… And that’s where things became strange.


Lady Medea, someone who was known to hate men in general, had taken a shine to the child without even meeting him directly or having a ‘proper’ conversation.


She for her life didn’t understand why that was so at the beginning. Well that was until he was passed the Book on the Human Magic System by Aaron.


She had watched with mouth agape as the boy did something that would take even geniuses a few months with the assistance of a good teacher.


And that was when she started realising different things about the boy.


The training weights that broke the furniture had to be at least several hundred kilograms if they could break the material of the furniture. He was far stronger than she realised.


She had never felt his strength at Mid Class Devil but that…


From then on she started to observe his training more and more and found to her sheer incredulity that the boy was completely out of common sense.


Lady Medea had relayed a direct order to keep the boy humble and thus she had to severely understate his strength to him. It wasn’t hard for her. She was the Head Maid of two hundred High Class Devils. Something like that took strength. Berta herself was an Ultimate Class Devil in terms of strength although she never took her High Class examinations.


This observation however had another effect. She began getting close to the child, unwittingly.


“My Lady, would he really be alright… that’s a Mid Class Demonic Beast. I know he himself is Middle Class, almost at the top of that range in terms of strength but… he has never fought anyone. He just doesn’t have the experience to go with it. The Demonic Beast is also resistant to magic attacks. He might…”


“Oh my, is that worry I see there Berta?” Lady Medea giggled and she stiffened at the realisation. She was however unperturbed, “Don’t worry about it, Berta. The Demonic Beast would probably be the easiest for him if he really wanted it to. Also… he is not a Mid Class Devil level in strength. He is easily a High Class Devil, upper ranges. I told you to not judge the boy by conventional means. Always estimate his strength a level above you can observe, two for caution.”


“A High Class Devil? But that… he’s just nine. Not even the Pillar Devils have that…” Aaron stuttered at the realisation.


“Don’t compare my gem to those entitled little brats. He is destined to surpass them all.”


Aaron went still at the bite in her voice and Berta realised that the things were probably far more complicated than she understood initially.


With several thoughts in mind, she watched Elias take on a test that would have other Mid Class Magicians running for their lives while still thinking of it as a Low Class exam.
